name: SonarCloud
description: Static Code Analysis tool for detecting "code smells", preventing bugs, security issues, etc.

name: JFrog/Artifactory
description: JFrog (formerly Artifactory) is a SaaS for hosting development artifacts like JARs, Ruby gems and Python packages developed internally by Creditas

name: IntelliJ IDEA
description: IntelliJ IDEA is a Java IDE from JetBrains with both free and commercial licenses. The Community Edition can be used free of charge, for Ultimate Edition licenses file a ticket to Service Desk.

name: PyCharm
description: PyCharm is a Python IDE from JetBrains with both free and commercial licenses. The Community Edition can be used free of charge, for Professional Edition licenses file a ticket to Service Desk.

name: WebStorm
description: WebStorm is a commercial Javascript IDE from JetBrains. To request a license, file a ticket to Service Desk.

name: DataGrip
description: DataGrip is a commercial database IDE from JetBrains. To request a licenses, file a ticket to Service Desk.

name: cliditas
description: cliditas is a CLI to manage application deployments on Creditas software development platform environments in Nucleon.

name: Sentry
description: Sentry is Application monitoring and error tracking, heavily used by Mobile team, and also by other teams

name: Rollbar
description: Rollbar is an error tracking service which was replaced by Sentry

name: Backstage
description: Backstage is a platform for building developer portals, and it's the base for our Developer Hub

name: CircleCI
description: CircleCI is the standard Continuous Integration platform at Creditas.

name: GitHub
description: https://github.com/creditas is our source control platform

name: GitHub Actions
description: GitHub Actions is a Continuous Integration platform native to GitHub.

name: Kong API Gateway
description: Kong is our API Gateway, responsible for exposing Creditas' APIs to the internet

name: AWS API Gateway
description: AWS API Gateway was used prior to adopting Kong, but it has shown to be too limited and complex

name: Nucleon
description: Nucleon is Creditas' PaaS, and its main objective is to enable developers to focus on solving business needs instead of managing infrastructure. Nucleon consists of some components that are built on top of other tools and services, like Terraform and Kubernetes.

name: New Relic
description: Platform for monitoring application performance (APM), availability, and much more.

name: Datadog
description: CORE is currently evaluating Datadog as a replacement for New Relic

name: Log Entries/Rapid7
description: LogEntries is a SaaS for logging. We don't have a contract with them anymore, and using is is a legal and security liability.

name: Cloudwatch Logs
description: Cloudwatch Logs, the AWS native logging platform, should only be used in legacy services not migrated to Nucleon yet

name: Elixir
description: Elixir was used by Bcredi developers but we don't recommend new applications or services to be written in Elixir because it doesn't have a large community or tooling support

name: Kotlin
description: Kotlin is the main programming language used in Creditas

name: Airflow
description: Doc - Airflow is a platform to programmatically author, schedule and monitor workflows.

name: React.js
description: The main framework to build frontend applications at Creditas

name: React Native
description: The main framework to build mobile applications at Creditas

name: GKE
description: A Kubernetes service managed by Google Cloud, used on Bcredi's services ecosystem

name: Ambassador
description: An API Gateway used on Bcredi's services ecosystem

name: RabbitMQ
description: RabbitMQ is an open source message broker used on Bcredi's services ecosystem to communication between services

name: KeyCloak
description: Keycloak is an open source identity and access management solution used on Bcredi's services ecosystem

name: Linkerd
description: Linkerd is a service mesh for Kubernetes used on Bcredi's services ecosystem to makes running services easier and safer by giving runtime debugging, observability, reliability, and security, all without requiring any changes to the code.

name: Google Cloud SQL (PostgreSQL)
description: PostgreSQL database service managed by Google Cloud, used on Bcredi's services ecosystem

name: Sendgrid
description: E-mail service provider, it was used on Bcredi's services ecosystem to sends e-mails to customers

name: InfoBip
description: SMS service provider, it was used on Bcredi's services ecosystem to sends SMS to customers

name: Salesforce Creditas
description: Salesforce at Creditas still being implemented

name: Salesforce Bcredi
description: The main backoffice tool for Bcredi operations

name: Ruby
description: Core & External Data & Servicing & Authentication & AutoFin Backend systems

name: Sidekiq
description: Message system for ruby components. This is default option

name: BFF
description: Backend end for frontend. Mobile and backoffice system uses this pattern to call our domain / components apis

name: Apollo
description: Framework to implement BFF as GraphQL

name: GraphQL
description: Pattern to expose API into a BFF

name: RDS - Postgres
description: PostgreSQL database service managed by AWS. Used in most of Creditas components

name: Mongo Atlas
description: Mongo managed database by Atlas service. Used in some components of creditas

name: AWS Lambda
description: Not supported by Nuclen / Cliditas. Used in most Product Hacking systems.

name: Camunda
description: BPMS engine to support statefull workflows.

name: Drools
description: BREs engine to support business rules strategy. It's been assessed by the Store team.

name: Opsgenie
description: Incident and alerting managing tool

name: Rails
description: Web framework for ruby components. This is the default choice

name: Hanami
description: Web framework for ruby components. Used only on core.

name: Spring
description: Web and DI framework for kotlin components. This should be the default option.

name: Typescript
description: used in frontend and BFF applications. This should be the default option.

name: Docker
description: Doc - Docker is an open platform for developing, shipping, and running applications. With Docker, you can manage your infrastructure in the same ways you manage your applications.

name: Docker Compose
description: Doc - Compose is a tool for defining and running multi-container Docker applications. With Compose, you use a YAML file to configure your application’s services.

name: Dbeaver
description: Doc - DBeaver is a universal database management tool for everyone who needs to work with data in a professional way.

name: Visual Studio Code
description: Doc - Visual Studio Code is a lightweight but powerful source code editor which runs on your desktop and is available for Windows, macOS and Linux.

name: aws-vault
description: Doc - AWS Vault is a tool to securely store and access AWS credentials in a development environment.

name: AWS Glue
description: Doc - AWS Glue is a serverless data integration service that makes it easy to discover, prepare, and combine data for analytics, machine learning, and application development.

name: Redash
description: Doc - Redash is an open source business intelligence web application

name: Metabase
description: Doc - Metabase is a simple and powerful analytics tool which lets anyone learn and make decisions from their company’s data

name: Tableau
description: Doc - Tableau is a visual analytics platform that want to transform the way people use data to solve problems.

name: AWS EMR Studio
description: Doc - EMR Studio is an integrated development environment (IDE) that makes it easy for data scientists and data engineers to develop, visualize, and debug data engineering and data science applications written in R, Python, Scala, and PySpark.
